summary: This document is a chain of FBI internal emails from September-October 2020 regarding a request for approval and funding for international travel to the UK. The purpose of the trip is for FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from SDNY to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation who is only willing to speak at length in person.

persons.name: FBI Agent (NY)
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, New York Field Office
persons.context: The primary FBI agent from New York requesting approval and funding for an international trip to London to interview a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell case. They communicate with FBI HQ about travel logistics and costs.

persons.name: FBI Agent (CID)
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit, FBI Headquarters (CID/VCS)
persons.context: An FBI agent at Headquarters who provides guidance on the travel approval process, indicates funding should not be a problem, and notes they are leaving the unit soon.

persons.name: FBI Agent (CID) (cc'd)
persons.role: Incoming FBI Special Agent, Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit, FBI Headquarters
persons.context: An FBI agent at Headquarters who is cc'd on the email and will be taking over the unit soon; the outgoing agent instructs the NY agent to include her on the cost estimate.

persons.name: 2 AUSAs from SDNY
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorneys, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Two federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York who were planning to travel with FBI agents to London to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

connections.description: Planning to travel together to London to interview a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, indicating a joint law enforcement and prosecutorial effort.
NY field agent coordinating with FBI Headquarters agent regarding travel approval and funding procedures for an international investigative trip.
Outgoing unit agent informing the NY agent that the cc'd agent will be taking over the unit soon and should be included on future correspondence.

events.title: Planned London trip canceled due to COVID
events.description: FBI agents and SDNY AUSAs had planned to travel to London in March 2020 to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, but the trip was canceled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

events.title: Video call with witness
events.description: The FBI agent and team spoke briefly via video with an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The witness is not comfortable talking at length unless it is in person.

events.title: Proposed travel dates to London
events.description: The FBI New York agent proposes traveling to London from October 12 through October 17, 2020, to conduct an in-person interview with the witness.

keyFacts: In late September 2020, the FBI and SDNY were actively seeking to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation who was located in London and insisted on an in-person meeting.
The witness had previously been contacted via video in September 2020 but was unwilling to speak at length remotely, prompting the need for international travel.
A planned trip for March 2020 was canceled due to COVID-19, indicating the investigation's international scope and persistence over time.
The travel request involved two FBI agents and two Assistant U.S. Attorneys from SDNY, showing coordinated effort between investigators and prosecutors.
The estimated cost for the trip for two people was $6,179, covering flights, lodging, per diem, and local transport for a 5-day period.
